prompt:
Describe the spatial relationships in this diagram.

CONTAINMENT: Which text labels are inside or outside each closed curve?
CONNECTIONS: Which text labels are connected by lines? Note any branching or unconnected lines.
BOUNDARY CROSSINGS: Do any lines cross the boundaries of closed curves?
NESTING: Are any closed curves nested inside others?

Do not interpret meaning. Only describe what you see spatially.
evaluation:
### CONTAINMENT:
- The word "wounded" is inside the topmost closed curve.
- The words "man" and "disgraces" are inside the middle closed curve.
- The word "man" is inside the bottom closed curve, which also contains the word "wounded."

### CONNECTIONS:
- A line connects the word "man" (outside the curves) to the word "wounded" inside the topmost closed curve.
- Another line connects the word "man" (outside the curves) to the word "man" inside the bottom closed curve.
- There is no branching observed in the lines, and there are no unconnected lines.

### BOUNDARY CROSSINGS:
- The line connecting "man" (outside the curves) to "wounded" crosses the boundary of the topmost closed curve.
- The line connecting "man" (outside the curves) to "man" crosses the boundary of the bottom closed curve.

### NESTING:
- The middle closed curve is nested inside the bottom closed curve.
